item.title: 巴斯夫是将获得价值 28 亿欧元德国补贴的企业之一
item.description: 德国在第一轮旨在帮助制造商向清洁能源转型的计划中拨出价值 28 亿欧元（31 亿美元）的补贴。【原文：Germany allocated subsidies worth €2.8 billion ($3.1 billion) in the first round of a program designed to help manufacturers shift to cleaner energy.】

item.title: 经过 "紧张 "的工作，Northvolt 报告救援谈判取得进展
item.description: 陷入困境的瑞典电池生产商 Northvolt AB 表示，该公司的救援方案谈判正在取得进展，并准备在本月晚些时候履行发薪义务。【原文：Sweden’s struggling battery maker Northvolt AB said it’s making progress in talks on a rescue package and is ready to meet its payroll obligations later in the month.】

item.title: 人工智能热潮引发澳大利亚养老基金向 DataBank 下注 20 亿美元
item.description:
数据中心开发商在美国建设三座大型设施的计划得到了澳大利亚超级保险公司（AustralianSuper）和数字桥公司（DigitalBridge）的支持。【原文：

The data center developer’s push to build out three large US facilities is being backed by AustralianSuper and DigitalBridge.

】

item.title: 今年最热门的应用程序是野火追踪器
item.description:
Watch Duty 正在与 TikTok 和 ChatGPT 争夺人气，它是越来越多帮助用户在日益严峻的火灾季节中保持安全的应用程序的一部分。【原文：

Watch Duty is vying with TikTok and ChatGPT in popularity, and it’s part of a growing number of apps helping users stay safe amid increasingly dire fire seasons. 

】

item.title: 遭受台风袭击的菲律宾呼吁加大投资以应对灾害风险
item.description: 菲律宾总统小费迪南德-马科斯（Ferdinand Marcos Jr.）周二表示，菲律宾的绿色债券市场有进一步扩大的潜力。【原文：Philippines President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. said on Tuesday the nation’s green bond market has the potential to expand further, in remarks that show the Asia-Pacific region is stepping up efforts to fund risks arising from extreme weather events.】

item.title: 银行家在生物多样性问题上无所适从
item.description:
欧洲和美国最大银行的金融家们表示，他们不知道如何衡量其对运营的影响，也不知道如何从中获利。【原文：

Financiers from the biggest banks in Europe and the US say they don’t understand how to measure its impact on operations — or make money from it.

】

item.title: 印度正在研究耗资 20 亿美元的环保船奖励计划
item.description: 印度正在最后敲定提供近 20 亿美元奖励的计划，以更清洁的船队取代以化石燃料为动力的内河客船，如驳船和渡船。【原文：India is finalizing plans to offer almost $2 billion in incentives to replace fossil-fuel powered passenger vessels on inland waterways, like barges and ferries, with a cleaner fleet.】

item.title: 北欧暖流蔓延，伦敦比马德里更热
item.description: 预计周三伦敦的气温将高于马德里，因为高于平均气温的气温在北欧蔓延，抑制了家庭取暖需求。【原文：London is forecast to be warmer than Madrid on Wednesday as above-average temperatures spread across northern Europe, curbing household heating demand.】

item.title: 台湾考虑从周边国家进口清洁能源
item.description: 台湾正在考虑在菲律宾或日本等邻近国家建设可再生能源发电厂，并将电力进口回国，以满足其制造商的需求。【原文：Taiwan is considering building renewable power plants in nearby countries like the Philippines or Japan and importing the electricity back home to feed the needs of its manufacturers.】

item.title: 印度推出价值 1090 亿美元的绿色能源传输计划
item.description: 印度电力部公布了一项电网改造计划，以适应 2032 年前可再生能源的大规模扩张。【原文：India’s power ministry unveiled a plan to revamp its power grid to accommodate a large renewable expansion through 2032.】

item.title: 哈萨克斯坦铀矿商投资者将就与中国的巨额交易进行投票
item.description: 世界第一大铀生产国哈萨克斯坦将于下月决定是否批准向中国核工业供应浓缩铀的巨额交易。【原文：Kazakhstan, the world’s No. 1 uranium producer, will decide next month on whether to approve a huge deal to supply concentrates to China’s nuclear industry.】

item.title: 受台风袭击的东南亚国家将在 2024 年前迎来雨季结束
item.description: 东南亚未来几个月的降雨量可能会高于正常水平，这将对该地区的农业、旅游业和工业生产造成进一步的破坏。【原文：Southeast Asia could see higher-than-normal rainfall in the coming months, threatening further disruptions to agriculture, tourism, and industrial output in a region already hit by a series of storms this year.】

item.title: 熊猫来了熊猫来了
item.description: 华盛顿（美联社）— 美国国家动物园的熊猫长期干旱似乎即将结束。【原文：WASHINGTON (AP) — The National Zoo's long dark panda drought seems to be coming to an end.】

item.title: 欧盟同意 COP29 气候立场，但资金问题仍悬而未决
item.description: 欧盟公布了其在下月举行的 COP29 气候谈判中的谈判立场，但却没有回答一个关键问题，即欧盟将如何增加对贫困国家应对全球变暖的资助。【原文：The European Union unveiled its negotiating stance for the COP29 climate talks next month, while leaving unanswered the key question of how it will boost funding for poorer countries in their fight against global warming.】

item.title: 飓风 "海伦 "和 "米尔顿 "预计将给保险公司造成高达 550 亿美元的损失
item.description: 根据穆迪 RMS 风险建模部门的数据，接连发生的飓风海伦和米尔顿预计将给保险公司造成 350 亿至 550 亿美元的损失。【原文：Back-to-back hurricanes Helene and Milton are expected to cost insurers $35 billion to $55 billion, according to Moody’s RMS risk-modeling unit.】

item.title: 欧盟与中国在关税开始前达成电动汽车协议面临障碍
item.description: 欧盟与中国之间的贸易谈判一直存在重大分歧，对中国制造的电动汽车征收关税的计划可能在本月底启动。【原文：Trade negotiations between the European Union and China have been plagued by major disagreements, with planned tariffs on Chinese-made electric vehicles likely to kick in at the end of the month.】

item.title: 法国将推动加强对俄罗斯液化天然气供应的跟踪
item.description: 法国和其他几个欧盟成员国将呼吁对俄罗斯的液化天然气进口进行更严格的跟踪，以帮助逐步摆脱对莫斯科供应的依赖。【原文：France and several other European Union member states are set to call for stricter tracking of Russian liquefied natural gas imports to help phase out reliance on Moscow’s supplies of the fuel.】

item.title: 创纪录热浪结束，美国西南部气温将下降 20 华氏度
item.description: 凤凰城和美国西南部破纪录的高温天气终于将在本周结束，本周末气温将骤降 20 华氏度（11 摄氏度）以上。【原文：The record-breaking heat across Phoenix and the US Southwest will finally end this week, with temperatures plummeting more than 20F (11C) degrees by this weekend.】

item.title: 中国碳价在履约期限到来前屡创新高
item.description: 随着工业履约期限的临近，供应短缺的可能性增大，中国的碳价格升至历史新高。【原文：China’s carbon prices rose to a record high as a looming compliance deadline for industries increased the prospect of a supply shortfall.】

item.title: 菲律宾最大的煤炭生产商计划耗资 50 亿美元扩建煤矿
item.description: 菲律宾最大的煤炭生产商塞米拉拉矿业与电力公司（Semirara Mining and Power Corp.【原文：Semirara Mining and Power Corp., the Philippines’ largest coal producer, said it’s looking to spend 291.4 billion pesos ($5.07 billion) to expand its mines.】

item.title: 受干旱影响的阿尔及利亚计划耗资 54 亿美元从海水中提取饮用水
item.description: 阿尔及利亚计划斥资 54 亿美元，扩建已经是非洲最大的海水淡化设施，因为气候变化对这个欧佩克成员国的水供应造成了巨大压力。【原文：Algeria plans to spend $5.4 billion boosting what are already Africa’s largest desalination facilities, as climate change piles pressure on the OPEC member’s water supplies.】

item.title: 灾难债券的残酷现实
item.description: 据初步估计，米尔顿飓风造成的损失高达数百亿美元。这是气候变化导致地球上大部分地区保护成本过高的最新例证。彭博绿色报道在今年的 "揭秘 "系列中对这一风险进行了调查。今天的故事是关于巨灾债券的，这是一种听起来很高明的保险解决方案，被推荐给发展中国家。然而，当灾难来临时，这种工具可能会让最脆弱的国家倒霉。【原文：Early estimates put the damage from Hurricane Milton in the tens of billions of dollars. It’s the latest example of how climate change is making large parts of the planet too expensive to protect. Bloomberg Green has been investigating that risk in this year’s “Uncovered” series. Today’s story is about catastrophe bonds, a clever-sounding insurance solution that’s being pitched to developing countries. Yet the instrument can leave the most vulnerable nations out of luck when disaster strikes.】

item.title: 雷诺发布法国制造电动汽车 售价低于 35,000 欧元
item.description: 雷诺汽车公司（Renault SA）推出了一款紧凑型电动汽车 R4 E-Tech，旨在帮助该汽车制造商更好地与以比亚迪公司（BYD Co.【原文：Renault SA unwrapped the R4 E-Tech, a compact electric vehicle meant to help the automaker better compete with budget offerings from Chinese manufactures led by BYD Co.】

item.title: 中国公司宣布海上风力涡轮机规模实现巨大飞跃
item.description: 中国东方电气集团（Dongfang Electric Corp.）宣布制造出一种新的涡轮机，其规模远远超过该行业以前的任何产品，令海上风电行业大吃一惊。【原文：China’s Dongfang Electric Corp. has surprised the offshore wind industry with an announcement that it’s built a new turbine radically larger than anything previously available in the sector.】

item.title: 原始森林一去不复返
item.description:
扭转森林砍伐和土地退化的努力正朝着错误的方向发展，暴露出联合国承诺的空洞。【原文：

Efforts to reverse deforestation and land degradation are moving in the wrong direction, exposing the hollowness of United Nations pledges.  

】

item.title: 英国警告在异常潮湿的九月后做好应对洪水的准备
item.description: 在经历了异常潮湿的九月份和有记录以来最潮湿的 18 个月后，英国政府呼吁人们为今年冬天的洪水做好准备。【原文：The UK government has urged people to prepare for flooding this winter after an unusually wet September and the wettest 18 months on record through February.】

item.title: 帮助佛罗里达的 "飓风保险 "如何辜负了最贫穷的国家
item.description:
灾难债券已成为华尔街管理气候灾害风险的新宠。但是，当不幸降临时，它们可能会让脆弱的国家倒霉。【原文：

Catastrophe bonds have become Wall Street’s new favorite way to manage the risk of climate-fueled disasters. But they can leave vulnerable nations out of luck when misfortune strikes.

】

item.title: 全球银行掀起新一轮针对自然的产品创新浪潮
item.description: 全球最大的几家银行即将齐聚一堂进行会谈，目的是将一个迄今为止华尔街大部分人还一无所知的主题货币化：自然和生物多样性。【原文：Some of the world’s biggest banks are about to gather for talks, with the goal of monetizing a theme that until now has left much of Wall Street drawing blanks: nature and biodiversity.】

item.title: 飓风米尔顿的洪水隐藏着一个肮脏的秘密
item.description:
暴风雨带来的洪水可能受到致病污水的污染，其遗留问题可能会导致霉菌问题和蚊虫爆发。【原文：

The storm’s floodwaters may be contaminated with disease-causing sewage, and their legacy could live on by causing mold problems and mosquito outbreaks.

】

item.title: 米尔顿事件后巨灾债券基金的风险溢价上升
item.description: 由于专门从事巨灾债券业务的资产管理公司对飓风米尔顿的影响做出了反应，发行巨灾债券的成本看来会上升。【原文：The cost of issuing catastrophe bonds looks set to go up, as asset managers who specialize in the securities react to the fallout from Hurricane Milton.】
